page.title: 16LOCAL RADIO AND TELEVISION
page.content: The local radio which serves this area is called{Severn Sound}which is broadcasted from Gloucester. An interview with a local listener showed these results: he said " It is a quite good programme for local news and every one hour there is a National news broadcast. Unfortunately the programme is spoilt by too many adverts and annoying signature tunes. The area is served by a television station "HTV" which mainly deals with the larger towns like Gloucester, Bath and Bristol. There is a local news broadcast after the six o'clock national news on "BBC WEST". The station "HTV" stands for Harlech Television, Lord Harlech was the Chairman of the British Board of Censors.
